name: Anthropic Claude
title: Anthropic Claude

children.text: , you can create prompts and manage your files, skills, and skill versions in your Anthropic Claude account.
Get started easily—no Anthropic account or API key required
You can send prompts without an Anthropic account or connection in Make using the
To use the Anthropic Claude app in
, you must request access to their API at
To get started, you must first create a connection between Anthropic Claude and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
To create the connection, you need to:

data.label: Anthropic Claude
data.overridedLabel: Obtain an API key in your Anthropic Claude account.

children.text: Obtain your API key in Anthropic Claude
Before you create the connection in
, you should first obtain an API key in your
In the bottom-left corner, click the key icon to access API keys.
Copy your key and store it in a safe place as you will not be able to view it again.
You'll use this value in the
account, add an Anthropic Claude module to your
field, enter a name for the connection.
field, enter the API key you copied from your Anthropic Claude account.
If prompted, authenticate your account and confirm access.
You've successfully created the connection and can now use the Anthropic Claude app in your
. If you want to make changes to your connection in the future, follow the steps
You can use the following Anthropic Claude modules to build your scenarios. The
module requires no setup, while other modules require connecting to the Anthropic Claude app.
The Simple Text Prompt (Beta) module allows you to select a model and enter your prompt, no other setup required.

The module uses credits based on the amount of input and output tokens consumed in each run. Input tokens depend on the prompt you enter, and output tokens are based on the response. After each run, you can see exactly how many tokens were used in the module's output.
The table below shows how input and output tokens convert to Make credits for Anthropic Claude models:
You can use the Download a File module only to download files generated by Anthropic Claude. You can generate files by using the
You can look for Anthropic Claude templates in
, where you'll find thousands of pre-created

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
